meta_description: The National Nordic Museum is dedicated to our Nordic history and cultural heritage. A great Seattle museum experience for all ages. Order passes online.
hours_text:
Menu

  * Get in Touch
  * Hours & Directions

Menu

  * Get in Touch
  * Hours & Directions

## Get in Touch

[(206) 789-5707](tel:2067895707 "Telephone")

[Send an Email](mailto:info@nordicmuseum.org "Email")

  * Museum Hours

The Museum is open Tuesday-Sunday from 10am-5pm, with extended hours every Thursday until 8pm. We are open year-round with the exception of Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day.  

  * Freya Café Hours

Freya Café is open Tuesday-Sunday from 10am-5pm, with extended hours every Thursday until 7pm. The café welcomes both Museum visitors and those looking for a cozy spot for fika in Ballard. **No Museum admission required!**  

  * Parking

The National Nordic Museum’s parking lot is located on the south side of the building and can be accessed from the corner of NW Market St and 28th Ave NW. Parking starts at $2.00 per hour and must be paid at the parking kiosks located at the base of the stairs or online via [Premium Parking](https://www.premiumparking.com/P5565). 

Alternative parking options are available along NW Market Street, in the residential neighborhoods surrounding the Museum, and at the Hiram Chittenden Locks parking lot—a five-minute walk to the Museum.

  * Public Transit

Ballard is serviced by Metro buses 17 and 44. 

**[Plan your trip](https://tripplanner.kingcounty.gov/)**

  * Website Login

A login is only required when purchasing tickets or renewing a Membership. Logging in ensures that Membership bene...
collections_text:
## Featured Exhibitions

  * [ Learn More ](https://nordicmuseum.org/exhibitions/new-nordic-cuisine-aesthetics-and-place)

What's On 

### [New Nordic: Cuisine, Aesthetics and Place ](https://nordicmuseum.org/exhibitions/new-nordic-cuisine-aesthetics-and-place)

_Food is more than nutrition – it is culture, identity and history._

Discover how a new Nordic food movement has sparked interest in local ingredients and natural materials across borders and artistic disciplines.  

[Learn More](https://nordicmuseum.org/exhibitions/new-nordic-cuisine-aesthetics-and-place)

  * [ Learn More ](https://nordicmuseum.org/exhibitions/eva-isaksen-shapes-for-fall)

What's On 

### [Eva Isaksen: Shapes for Fall ](https://nordicmuseum.org/exhibitions/eva-isaksen-shapes-for-fall)

_Shapes for Fall_ features nine works from artist Eva Isaksen in the Museum's Fjord Hall Alcove.  

[Learn More](https://nordicmuseum.org/exhibitions/eva-isaksen-shapes-for-fall)

  * [ Learn More ](https://nordicmuseum.org/exhibitions/project-aurora)

What's On 

### [Ginny Ruffner: Project Aurora ](https://nordicmuseum.org/exhibitions/project-aurora)

Iconic Ballard artist Ginny Ruffner's monumental _Project Aurora_ has found its permanent home at the National Nordic Museum. A wall of light 20’ in height and aided by artificial intelligence, the installation evokes the Aurora Borealis as its undulations mimic the unpredictability of the natural phenomenon.
